name: European Language Equality Network
headAddress: 6 Plasenn Gwirioù Mab-Den,  Ti ar Vro
membership: ELEN has consultative status with the EP, the Council of Europe, the UN and UNESCO. They sit on the European Commission NGO Platform for Multilingualism, the NGO Platform for Culture, the NGO Platform for the EU Fundamental Rights Agency, and the UN's ECOSOC.
goal:
ELEN has as its goal, to the exclusion of any profit seeking, the promotion and protection of lesser-used (i.e. regional, minority, indigenous, co-official and smaller state) languages, hereafter LULs, to work towards linguistic equality for these languages under the broader framework of human rights, and to be a voice for the speakers of LULs at the local, regional, national, European and international level.
To accomplish this goal, the Network will:
•engage in advocacy for the promotion and protection of LULs;
•exchange information and experience regarding policy making for LULs at the European, national and regional level of governance;
•promote education and research in and about LULs;
•promote understanding, collaboration and partnerships for LULs in the broader context of the promotion of linguistic diversity.
interests: Borders and Security, Budget, Communication, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Enlargement, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives:
Multilingualism, linguistic diversity, fundamental rights, human rights, languages, culture.
Digital Single Market, language perspectives
Copyright
Geo-data blocking
